triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: Hypergraphs are the foundational data structure that hypergraph neural networks operate on, generalizing graphs to allow edges to connect any number of vertices.

triples.name: Graph neural network
triples.relevance: The paper references and builds upon existing graph neural network approaches when discussing extensions to hypergraph settings.

triples.name: Heterophily
triples.relevance: The paper introduces metrics and methods for handling heterophily in hypergraphs, addressing a gap in the existing research.

triples.name: Wavelet
triples.relevance: The paper uses framelet-based approaches (related to wavelets) to build the proposed HyperUFG model.

triples.name: Low-pass filter
triples.relevance: Low-pass filters are integrated into HyperUFG as a component for filtering high-order correlations in hypergraphs.

triples.name: High-pass filter
triples.relevance: High-pass filters are integrated into HyperUFG as a complementary component to handle heterophilic patterns in hypergraphs.
